page.title: 15Old Mattersey Thorpe
page.content: Bleak House Farm is in group of houses which might once have been called Old Mattersey. There used to be 5 farms but only one now works. The Gables, once a farmhouse, has been converted into 3 separate cottages. One of these has been empty for about 30 years. Next door are two more cottages which used to be farm buildings with a granary at the top. Adjacent is Bleak House Farm which was built in 1797. All the original farm buildings including a big barn and dove cote are still there. During the war the farmer had some Italian prisoners of war helping work the farm. They lived in one of the attics. Bleak House Farm stopped being a farm about 20 years ago. At the bottom of the road is The Poplars, which used to be a small farm but is now a big house with three grass fields.
